title: Saira Khan loves her 'tiny boobs' and slams Love Island girls for taking surgery 'too far'
text:

Saira Khan has hit out at young celebs' obsession with plastic surgery, declaring that she loves her "tiny boobs".

The Loose Women panelist, 49, said the current generation of reality TV stars like the Love Island girls have taken their cosmetic work "too far".

She explained that she's never felt the pressure to get work done because she doesn't need it to feel good about herself.

Saira told Mirror Online: "When I look at the girls on Love Island I do feel a bit sad for them that every single one of them at such a young age feels like they've got to inject themselves, get their lips done, gets their t**s done, get everything done.

(Image: iamsairakhan/Instagram)

(Image: REX)

"But you're only 20! I understand women considering that in their 50s or later on in life because you do lack a bit of confidence as you get older but I don't understand why you do in your 20s.

"Every single one of them has taken it too far. Starting it that early is taking it too far."

Saira is mum to Zach, 11, and Amara, eight, with her husband Steve Hyde.

She said she is bringing them up so they don't feel like they have to go down the cosmetic surgery route to be confident.

The businesswoman hopes they can follow her example at being completely natural.

Saira continued: "I'm bringing my kids up to think it's OK to be different, you don't have to follow the crowd.

(Image: iamsairakhan/Instagram)

"It's what our family values are and to be honest as a mother I can only show them by example.

"They see me working out, they see me looking after my skin, I've got my own skincare range, and I talk very openly to them.

"Ive got very tiny boobs and I've never felt the need or pressure to have false boobs because, to be honest, I don't need them for my confidence."
description: EXCLUSIVE: The Loose Women panelist, 49, admitted that she's never felt the pressure to get cosmetic work done
